previous_headings: R package for assessing power of biodiversity monitoring sampling schemes.
title: Analyze Power to Detect Change in Biodiversity Sampling Schemes
text: Reliable biodiversity monitoring requires understanding sampling effort influences detectability meaningful changes species richness. Yet robust methods quantifying statistical power lacking richness cumulative metric: biodiversity assessments typically compare two communities, rather means across independent replicates, making traditional power analyses inappropriate. BioDivPoweR allows simulation-based quality-assurance power analysis user-provided pilot data detect richness differences different sampling efforts within communities.

title: Analyze Power to Detect Change in Biodiversity Sampling Schemes
Analyze Power to Detect Change in Biodiversity Sampling Schemes
text: workflow contains two functions, must run order. workflow can either used two-treatment analysis ‚Äì example, detecting differences richness high vegetation low vegetation sites ‚Äì within single treatment ‚Äì detecting changes richness one sampling location time.

title: Analyze Power to Detect Change in Biodiversity Sampling Schemes
text: First, bootstrap_pilot() creates bootstrapped simulated communities user-provided pilot data achieve sense possible richness differences given community structure. output function contain simulated community pairs span range reasonable potential effect sizes, used evaluate ability detect change across sample scheme coverage. See function help page details customizable variables refining resolution boostrap step.
code: # get example pilot data, or supply your own # here, using a two-treatment scenario: data("pilot_two_trts")  # run bootstrap function: two_trt_boots <- bootstrap_pilot(pilot_two_trts,                                  method = "two",                                  category_col = "veg_score")

title: Analyze Power to Detect Change in Biodiversity Sampling Schemes
text: Second, downsample_boots() uses replicated simulated communities known differences richness (effect sizes) simulate differences detected fewer samples taken. function produces functional relationship sample coverage (proportion community thought present given sample number), minimum difference richness can confidently detected. function also offers several user-defined additions, target effect sizes users want confidently detect, cost samples, power users want detect differences. See function help page details.
code: # downsample bootstrapped communities across sample sizes (community coverage) two_trt_sub <- subsample_boots(two_trt_boots,                                pilot_two_trts,                                method = "two")

title: Analyze Power to Detect Change in Biodiversity Sampling Schemes
text: Together, functions produce relationship sample size power pilot community, can used guide continued sampling optimize sampling effort, sampling power, expected effect sizes richness change.

what: Bootstrap Biodiversity Samples from Species-by-Site Matrix ‚Äî bootstrap_pilot
title: Bootstrap Biodiversity Samples from Species-by-Site Matrix ‚Äî bootstrap_pilot
text: Creates `n_boots` simulated communities pilot biodiversity survey, pulled randomly drawn sites `pilot` survey, replacement. Bootstrapped pairs compared differences richness, differences richness (log2 ratio) sorted histogram `n_eff_size_bins` bins. possible, `min_exp_n` experiments (pairs simulated communities, rarefied equal sample coverage) retained kept input following function, `subsample_boots()`.

title: Bootstrap Biodiversity Samples from Species-by-Site Matrix ‚Äî bootstrap_pilot
code: bootstrap_pilot(   pilot,   method = "single",   category_col = NULL,   n_boots = 5000,   n_eff_size_bins = 40,   min_exp_n = 40,   seed = NULL )

title: Bootstrap Biodiversity Samples from Species-by-Site Matrix ‚Äî bootstrap_pilot
text: pilot species--site matrix pilot biodiversity survey, either single treatment (matrix multiple samples within one study area), two treatments (e.g., high vs. low vegetation sites, restored vs. unrestored), column specifies treatment type. Single-treatment analysis assesses power detect richness change within one study area time, two-treatment assesses power detect change two site types. method power analysis type, `"single"` sites treatment levels, `"two"` two-treatment analysis. category_col column name `pilot` specifies treatment value sampling sites, two-treatment analysis selected. n_boots number simulated community pairs bootstrap, compared differences species richness. Increasing number bootstrapped communities result effect sizes (differences richness simulated pairs) qualifying power analysis (histogram richness differences `n_boots` communities sorted `n_eff_size_bins`, bins surpass `min_exp_n` threshold retained following steps). n_eff_size_bins n_eff_size_bins total number bins separate histogram  richness differences detected simulated communities. Increasing `n_eff_size_bins` can offer higher resolution following steps (bins qualify), can result "toothy" histograms sequential bins filled. Decreasing `n_eff_size_bins` fix "toothiness". min_exp_n threshold number simulated pairs qualify given effect size bin retention. Higher `min_exp_n` values offer greater resolution following steps, decrease number effect sizes qualify. seed Random seed. Defaults 1 runs data provide answers, since simulations rely random draws, changing seed result different answers.

title: Bootstrap Biodiversity Samples from Species-by-Site Matrix ‚Äî bootstrap_pilot
text: tibble `min_exp_n` simulated communities, rarefied equal coverage, within effect size bins qualify. Additionally, prints histogram simulated community richness values, highlighting bins kept next step.

what: Subsample bootstrapped communities to assess power for detecting change across community coverage ‚Äî subsample_boots
title: Subsample bootstrapped communities to assess power for detecting change across community coverage ‚Äî subsample_boots
text: Downsample bootstrapped communities lower sample sizes representing gradient coverage values, assess proportion correct-direction detections within coverage interval.

title: Subsample bootstrapped communities to assess power for detecting change across community coverage ‚Äî subsample_boots
code: subsample_boots(   boots,   pilot,   method = "single",   power = c(80),   target_eff_size = NULL,   cost_per_sample = NULL,   seed = NULL )

title: Subsample bootstrapped communities to assess power for detecting change across community coverage ‚Äî subsample_boots
text: pilot original pilot study. Identical pilot input `bootstrap_pilot()` power statistical power user wants detect richness change (defaults 80). target_eff_size supplied, level richness difference user wants detect (log2 ratio units). Adding target value change outputs function, specifying sampling needs reach richness difference target. cost_per_sample cost per unit sample (linear ), add axis output plots total cost per unit power. seed random seed. Defaults 1 repeat runs identical, since simulations rely random draws, changing seed result different answers. data tibble bootstrapped communities across multiple effect sizes. Output `bootstrap_pilot()`.

title: Subsample bootstrapped communities to assess power for detecting change across community coverage ‚Äî subsample_boots
text: List outputs: (1) Plot convergence detections across community coverage multiple effect size bins. (2) Plot mean detection across community coverage within multiple effect size bins. (3) Plot proportion correct detections across community coverage within multiple effect size bins. (4) Plot functional relationship sample size power detect richness differences. (5) Tibble input output values.

title: Subsample bootstrapped communities to assess power for detecting change across community coverage ‚Äî subsample_boots
